title: Status change for Chinese peasant women

content.question: Which of the following led to the most dramatic change in the status of Chinese peasant women in the 1940’s and 1950’s?

choices.label: The policies of Jiang Jieshi (Chiang Kaishek) that attempted to give rural women more economic opportunities
Maoist policies that banned arranged marriages and made women an important part of the Communist women’s movement
The Christian missionaries and their work among peasant families
The success of the Japanese during the occupation in making men and women equal participants in the economy
United Nation policies that provided women in rural China with resources and an education

content.answer: Maoist policies that banned arranged marriages and made women an important part of the Communist women’s movement
